data.title: Taylor Swift Thanked by The Starting Line for Name-Dropping Them in Song: ‚ÄòFlattered and Humbled‚Äô
data.meta_description: Swift name-dropped the band in her song "The Black Dog" on her new album 'The Tortured Poets Department'
data.text:
Swift name-dropped the band in her song "The Black Dog" on her new album 'The Tortured Poets Department'

Taylor Swift is being thanked by pop-punk band The Starting Line.

Swift, who released her 11th album The Tortured Poets Department on April 19, released her new song ‚ÄúThe Black Dog‚Äù and included the lyrics, ‚ÄúWhen someone plays The Starting Line/And you jump up/But she's too young to know this song.‚Äù

‚ÄúRe: ‚ÄòThe Black Dog‚Äô Dear Taylor, We heard the song, thank you for name checking our band. We feel flattered and humbled by the reverberations of love that have come back to us as a result,‚Äù The Starting Line wrote in a post on Instagram. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs an honor to have TSL memorialized on such a lovely song. You didn‚Äôt have to do that, but you did, and we appreciate it wholeheartedly. Respect!‚Äù

They then penned the post with, ‚ÄúLove The Starting Line PS #4OTW.‚Äù

‚ÄúThank you @taylorswift,‚Äù their caption read.

Never miss a story ‚Äî sign up for PEOPLE's free daily newsletter to stay up-to-date on the best of what PEOPLE has to offer, from juicy celebrity news to compelling human interest stories.

Related: Pregnant Jenna Dewan Shows Off Her Baby Bump with Cute Nod to Taylor Swift's New Album

The post included a slide of lead singer Kenny Vasoli smiling onstage.

The Starting Line were formed in Churchville, Pennsylvania in 1999. Their songs include 2002‚Äôs ‚ÄúThe Best of Me,‚Äù ‚ÄúLeaving‚Äù and 2007‚Äôs ‚ÄúSomething Left to Give.‚Äù

‚ÄúWhat song do we think she‚Äôs referencing? My guess is ‚Äòthe best of me!‚Äô ‚ù§Ô∏è,‚Äù one person commented under The Starting Line‚Äôs post, while a second wrote, ‚ÄúThat moment when you realize you‚Äôre a musical influence to one of the biggest stars on the planet.‚Äù

Related: Taylor Swift Makes Swiftie Cassey Ho's 'Dream Come True' by Wearing Lilac Skirt She Designed in YouTube Clip

Meanwhile, another user left a hopeful comment, ‚ÄúTaylor next tour: ‚ÄòWhat if I told you Kenny Vasoli was here to sing The Best of Me for you guys!?!?‚Äô "

The Starting Line‚Äôs post comes after Swift celebrated positive reviews of The Tortured Poets Department on her Instagram Stories on April 21.

She first reposted Rolling Stone‚Äôs review, titled "Come for the Torture, Stay for the Poetry" with an "Instant Classic" stamp added.

Swift then reshared a five-star review of TTPD from U.K. newspaper The Times and quoted her song ‚ÄúThe Alchemy‚Äù with her caption, which read, ‚Äúü§çThese chemicals hit me like whiiiiite wiiiiineü§ç."
